Network tools used in MGT¶

network_utils module consists of the base MGnetwork class that contains the tools for Network analysis.

class network_utils.MGNetwork¶

Bases: object

  • Description : Utility for crating network graphs from the MGT results.

  • Author : Nixon

add_backbone(data, chain_id=None, node_name='resid')¶

Add all nodes and their backbone edges.

Parameters

  • data -- dataframe with basic datas of a protein

  • chain_id -- segment id in original pdb file

  • node_name -- node name to follow, if resid, the resids are taken if resno, the residue numbers are taken

Returns

Graph object with backbone edges added

draw_protein_graph(G, kbcut, imp_res=None)¶

Draw 2D protein graph using NetworkX, shows interactions of all residues > kbcut.

Parameters

  • G (object) -- graph object with all nodes and edges with necessary attributes

  • kbcut (int) -- draw interaction greater than coupling strength cutoff

  • imp_res -- resids to highlight

  • type -- list of strings

draw_sub_protein_graph(G, resids, col, res_overlap=None, kbcut=0.0, intra=False, prefix=None)¶

Draw 2D protein graph using NetworkX, only interactions between given resids > kbcut.

Parameters

  • G (object) -- graph object with all nodes and edges with necessary attributes

  • resids -- resids whose interactions are plotted

  • type -- list of strings

  • col (string) -- color for resids

  • kbcut (int) -- draw interaction greater than coupling strength cutoff

  • intra (Boolean) -- if True, get edgeslists of intra interactions of given resids False, get all interacting edgelists of given resids (default)

  • prefix (string) -- prefix for title

get_interacting_edges(G, nodes, kbcut, intra=False)¶

Get edgelists for a set of nodes, if interactions are present

Parameters

  • G -- graph object

  • nodes -- list of nodes to get combinations

  • kbcut -- kb cut off

  • intra -- if True: get only intra interacting edges for given nodes False: get all interacting edges of the given nodes

graph_mtrx(mat)¶

Returns the Adjacency, Degree, Laplacian Matrices using edge_weights

Parameters

mat (pd.DataFrame) -- the symmetric K matrix

Returns

adjacency matrix, Degree matrix, laplacian matrix and normalized laplacian matrix

Return type

numpy arrayedg

network_utils.parse_pdb(pdb_handle)¶

Parses the PDB file as a pandas DataFrame object.

Backbone chain atoms are ignored for the calculation of interacting residues.

network_utils.retrieve_name(var)¶

Get function or variable name as string

Parameters

var -- the variable or function as input

Returns

string of var name

network_utils.to_commaseparray(inp)¶

Converts many int in a string to array of ints

Parameters

inp -- string with int separated by spaces

Returns

array of int

network_utils.xypos(G)¶

Get x and y coordinates of given graph object

Parameters

G -- graph object to add x, y coordinates

Returns

graph object with attributes x and y added
